result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronnie Cole Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.
Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Huber for employment.  Do not report to the jail late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances.  May transfer to Milwaukee County, but not on day reporting or electronic monitoring.    CORRECTED 05-17-2016:  CFTS
**CORRECTED 6-1-2016:  To include conditional jail time on Ct. 2.**

to remove DNA surcharge

Defendant Ronnie Cole in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Amended informations filed in each file.
Reading of both is waived.
Not guilty pleas entered by the Court.
Plea questionnaires filed.
Joint recommendation:  Plea to charges in each of the files.  2 yr probation.  No alcohol, controlled substances, RUAs, AODA and follow through.  Other appropriate counseling.  5 mos RCJ w/huber.  May be served in Milwaukee House of Corrections provided it is not on day reporting or electronic monitoring.
Court conducts colloquy with defendant re rights being waived, elements of charges and possible penalties.
State consents to jury waiver.
PLEA - guilty each of 3 counts
Court finds plea entered freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently
Finding of guilt
Defendant's father speaks on behalf of defendant
State's sentencing argument
Defense sentencing argument
Defendant speaks on own behalf
BTC:  2 yrs probation
no alcohol, controlled substances; RUAs; AODA, aftercare
other appropriate counseling
5 mos RCJ w/huber.  May transfer to Milw Cty if not on ELM or day reporting
costs, assessments, surcharges 
no DNA surcharge on 325 file
60 DTP costs or 3 mos RCJ

Defendant Ronnie Cole in court with attorney Wendy S. Paul.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.
ZCI
Preliminary hearing on March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
Defendant is not in court. Defense requests adjournment. State does not object to a one week adjournment. 
BTC: Adjournment granted.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ZCI

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendant, MC. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Preliminary hearing on March 19, 2015 at 09:00 am.
